summary:
"Amazing Grace" is a well-known Christian hymn written by John Newton in 1772. Newton, once a slave trader, had a spiritual conversion after a dangerous storm at sea. He later became an abolitionist and a priest. The hymn, meant to illustrate a sermon, was first published in 1779. It gained immense popularity in the United States during the Second Great Awakening in the 1800s.

The song's message of forgiveness and redemption resonates with many. It has been sung with various melodies and has crossed over into secular music, becoming one of the most recognizable songs in the English language.
title: Amazing Grace
